intro: Erigeron orithales, commonly known as the silverleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It has silvery-gray leaves that help reduce water loss in arid environments. Erigeron orithales blooms in the summer, producing small white or pale yellow flowers that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies.
